physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Reported intense sharp groin pain with weight-bearing, and the need to lift the right leg with both hands to get in and out of the car.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially intermittent stiffness changed to intense, sharp groin pain.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Left lower extremity externally rotated; significant tenderness over the right femoral triangle; active ROM of the right hip provoked sharp right groin pain; positive signs of possible hip pathology.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Pain increased from stiffness to severe incapacitating pain, with a high intensity of 9/10.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Similar physical examination findings to those at 29 weeks gestation; continued presence of right hip pain.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postpartum evaluation showed similar findings without significant improvement.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Conventional radiograph revealed normal mineralization of the right femur and acetabulum.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression noted from previously observed osteopenia to normal mineralization.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI revealed slight residual high-signal intensity in the right femoral head and acetabulum, indicating a marked reduction of bone marrow edema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant improvement evidenced by decreased bone edema compared to previous MRI.
